title: Order the numbers.
text: The first step to finding the median would be to order the values in ascending order.
speech: The first step to finding the median would be to order the values in ascending order.
pacedSpeech: The first step to finding the median would be to order the values in ascending order.

title: Finding the midpoint.
text: The next step would be to find the midpoint. You do this by taking the total number of entries (10) and dividing by $$2$$. The mid point for an even number would be the average between entries $$5$$ and $$6$$. If there is an odd amount of entries you would round up and use that entry as the median. This gives us a median of $$3$$.

The mid point for an even number would be the average between entries  5  and  6 . If there is an odd amount of entries you would round up and use that entry as the median. This gives us a median of  3 .
